name: Navigation
description: Points of Interest that assist with navigation, such as beacons, relays, or landmarks that help travelers orient themselves in space.

name: Hazard
description: Dangerous phenomena or locations that pose a risk to ships and crews, such as radiation storms, asteroid fields, or space anomalies.

name: Wreckage
description: Remnants of destroyed ships or stations, which may contain valuable salvage or clues about past events.

name: Resource
description: Locations rich in valuable materials or resources that can be extracted or harvested.

name: Mystery
description: Unexplained phenomena or locations that defy easy categorization, often shrouded in secrecy or intrigue.

name: Outpost
description: Small stations or settlements that serve as hubs for trade, rest, or information exchange.

name: Jump Gate
description: Massive structures that allow for instantaneous travel between two points in space. Their technology is highly advanced and not fully understood.
